standfirst: The US president says he has 'serious concerns' over the rising number of deaths on both sides of recent violence between Israel and Gaza. Barack Obama claims that while he supports Israel's right to defend itself against rockets fired by Hamas, he is hopeful the two sides can reach a ceasefire agreement. US Secretary of State John Kerry is on his way to the Middle East to facilitate talks between the two sides
headline: Barack Obama: we are focused on Israel-Gaza ceasefire - video

standfirst: Gabriele Lauschet, who was 47, was a teacher at the German International School at Terrey Hills
headline: MH17: Sydney teacher identified as victim of Malaysia Airlines disaster

standfirst: Attackers claimed retribution for raid on Mpeketoni as growing political tension sees rise in violence
headline: Gunmen kill four and injure several others in revenge attack in Mombasa

standfirst: Paris jail known for brutal conditions, which once housed Carlos the Jackal, Jean Genet and Jacques Mesrine, to reopen in 2019
headline: France's notorious La Santé prison receives four-year renovation term

standfirst: Thousands of protesters have taken to the streets of Sydney in opposition to the Israeli ground invasion of Gaza. The Australian government has refrained from directly criticising Israel, instead censuring Hamas for refusing to accept an Egyptian-brokered ceasefire proposal. Protesters decried Israel as a 'terrorist state' while a number shouted 'God is great' in Arabic
headline: Thousands protest in Sydney over Israel ground invasion of Gaza - video

standfirst: Video taken on Friday purports to show the black box recorder of flight MH17 being removed from its crash site in Ukraine, as cranes were used to remove part of the plane over the weekend. Rebel fighters say they have the black box and are prepared to hand it to international experts when they arrive in the town of Donetsk
headline: MH17: purported black box recorder being removed from crash site – video

standfirst: Swedish filmmaker taps into the primary violence of the coloniser rather than the colonised, says Bhakti Shringarpure
headline: Fanon documentary confronts fallacies about anti-colonial philosopher

standfirst: Alex Kozinski says 'enterprise is flawed' and that America should return to the firing squad because current system is so ineffective
headline: Top judge attacks lethal injection as Arizona fails in death penalty appeal

standfirst: Tony Abbott has branded the scene at the site of the MH17 disaster 'absolutely shambolic' and pushed for the repatriation of the 37 Australians killed. Abbott also said that in his most recent conversations with Vladimir Putin, the Russian president had 'said all the right things', 'but the challenge now is to hold the president to his word'
headline: Malaysia Airlines crash site 'absolutely shambolic', says Australian PM – video

standfirst: As the death toll in Gaza passes 500, UN chief Ban Ki-moon calls on Israel to 'exercise maximum restraint' and spare civilian lives. Israeli continues to shell Gaza from the air and the ground on Monday. Sunday was one of the bloodiest days in Gaza, with Israel targeting the eastern neighbourhood of Shujai'iya
headline: Gaza death toll soars as UN urges Israel restraint – video

standfirst: Ruling Communist party says firm belief in Marxism will help keep country's clamour for western-style democracy at bay
headline: China increases officials' Communist education to prevent 'moral decline'

standfirst: Two-day event organised by Human Rights Foundation aims to find new ways to spread information inside North Korea. North Korea Tech reports
headline: Silicon Valley to host North Korea 'hackathon'

standfirst: Aids 2014 symposium in Melbourne hears drug combination known as PaMZ can treat drug-resistant TB in as little as four months
headline: New drug therapy allows tuberculosis and HIV to be treated simultaneously

standfirst: On eve of Girl Summit, ODI reveals trend of girls entering early marriages followed by swift divorces to migrate for family's sake
headline: Ethiopia's child brides see marriage as key to jobs abroad, says thinktank

standfirst: Siraj was sentenced to 30 years in prison in 2007 for conspiring to plant bombs in New York City. The way he got there is similar to a spate of US 'stings' to capture terror suspects since 9/11
headline: Shahawar Matin Siraj: 'impressionable' young man caught in an NYPD sting

standfirst:
• Eric Garner died on Thursday after confrontation
• Medics' restrictions in effect pending investigation
headline: Four emergency workers on 'modified duty' over NYPD chokehold death

standfirst: Experts fear that evidence of how the Malaysia Airlines MH17 plane was brought down could be lost for ever as evidence disappears from the crash site
headline: MH17 crash site chaos - in pictures

standfirst: Move means special meeting of EU foreign ministers is unlikely to press ahead with generalised economic sanctions
headline: MH17 black box handover set to delay escalation of sanctions against Russia

standfirst: New report shows how police, sex workers and drugs users can work together to beat HIV
headline: Aids conference hears why Ghana police chief carries bag of condoms

• Deputy chief resigns but denies KKK membership
headline: Police ties to Ku Klux Klan shock Florida town of Fruitland Park

• Case attracts concern over race issues
headline: Renisha McBride shooting trial set to begin in Detroit
